head.title: Seven Are Hurt as Police Chase Shooting Suspect

hedline.hl1: Seven Are Hurt as Police Chase Shooting Suspect

abstract.p: Seven people, including two police officers, are injured in Brooklyn when police van smashes into vehicle while officers are chasing Anthony Gambels, suspect in shooting (M)

block.p: Seven people, including two police officers, were injured yesterday in Brooklyn when a police van smashed into a vehicle while officers were chasing a suspect in a shooting, officials said.
The accident occurred at about 6 p.m. at the intersection of Linden Boulevard and Hinsdale Street in the Brownsville section, said Officer George Jensen, a police spokesman.
Seven people, including two police officers, were injured yesterday in Brooklyn when a police van smashed into a vehicle while officers were chasing a suspect in a shooting, officials said.
The accident occurred at about 6 p.m. at the intersection of Linden Boulevard and Hinsdale Street in the Brownsville section, said Officer George Jensen, a police spokesman.
Mr. Jensen said that the officers responded to reports of a shooting and had begun chasing a suspect, identified as Anthony Gambels, 22, when the accident happened.
Mr. Gambels was arrested after the crash and charged in the shooting. Police officials said last night that they did not know the name or condition of the shooting victim.

The two officers in the van were taken to Brookdale Hospital Medical Center. Five people in the vehicle that the van struck were also injured. Two were taken to Brookdale, and two others were taken to Jamaica Hospital Medical Center, fire officials said. The fifth person suffered minor injuries and refused medical attention.
The names and conditions of the injured people were not immediately released.
